subtitle: Creamy Mascarpone combines beautifully with peppery watercress to give these stuffed eggs real bite!

method.text: Put the eggs in a large pan. Cover with cold water. Bring to the boil and cook for 10 min. Tip away the hot water and put the pan under cold running water for 2 min. Leave the eggs in water until completely cold. Remove the shells.
Trim a little of the egg whites off each end to make a flat base. Then cut in half widthways. Scoop out the yolks and reserve.

Set aside 20 small sprigs of watercress for garnishing. Place the remainder in a food processor or blender with the egg yolk, mascarpone, nutmeg and seasoning. Process until fairly smooth and well mixed.
Spoon the watercress mixture into a piping bag fitted with 1 <sup>1</sup>/<sub>4</sub> cm star nozzle. Pipe swirls into the egg whites. Garnish with watercress sprigs. Chill until ready to serve.

title: Mascarpone and watercress stuffed eggs
